channel.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
channel.description:
Helo everyone!
I'm kind of noob with Steam mods and SDK, can somebody explain the instalation proces, and how to run the game?
I dont have a source game I download the SDK 2007. I download the torrent file and Installed it, after it finished i just say to run it. But now that i closed the game I don't know what to do.
Any help please? I'm really enjoying this mod!!!:retard:

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: cman2k
item.description:
We also posted about needing the SDK on facebook. And twitter. And the Steam Group.

We tried!

Read full topic

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: BigDaz
item.description:
I installed the mod, then the SDK.
Black Mesa did not show up in my list of games until I restarted Steam.

Read full topic

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
Before the release there was a stickied thread where a developer (was it Hubi?) described the prerequisites for the mod (SDK, disk space). Was it deleted in the transition?

Now this info is in the wiki: https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/System_Requirements

Edit: nevermind, the post is there. it’s the stickied one in the news section Launch Details

Read full topic

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: Yosharian
item.description:
Katana:

Yosharian, what it needs is the Source SDK Base (2007). It’s essentially the latest version of the source engine as a “game” without any content in it. You can’t play Black Mesa without that installed, and we did try to explain this to people beforehand.

Go to your library, click in the upper left and select Tools, then look in that list.

I know that now. What I’m trying to figure out is the most efficient way to get hold of this. Installing HL2:E2/TF2 didn’t automatically install the SDK.

Installing HL2:E2 appears to have speeded up the download somewhat. Just waiting on 200MB or so now. (or maybe it was TF2 that speeded it up, god knows)

“and we did try to explain this to people beforehand.”

It doesn’t specify that SDK is needed when you click on the ‘download’ button on the main page. Even a little note at the bottom of that dialog saying BTW U NEED SOURCE SDK DOWNLOAD THAT FROM STEAM would have been fine. I can’t find anywhere on the main page any reference to SDK at all.

By the way, not meaning to sound negative, I’m bloody stoked to play this, that’s all.

Read full topic

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
Yosharian, what it needs is the Source SDK Base (2007). It’s essentially the latest version of the source engine as a “game” without any content in it. You can’t play Black Mesa without that installed, and we did try to explain this to people beforehand.

Go to your library, click in the upper left and select Tools, then look in that list.

Read full topic

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: Yosharian
item.description:
I too, am confused with this. I downloaded and installed the Black Mesa mod, went to Steam to load it, and… up pops a dialog asking me to download the Source SDK? Great, another 4GB download.

So I do a little googling but nobody appears to know how to get this thing without downloading it, off to Orange Box I go. Installed TF2… no SDK. Installing H2:E2… about to find out whether SDK is included in that…

I’m sure everyone that reads this is going to respond with H4R H4R N00B DIDN’T EVEN KNOW SOURCE SDK WAS REQUIRED but really, it didn’t specify this on the website. I could have downloaded this in advance if I had known.

Read full topic

item.title: INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALATION?
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
The mod can be run from Steam after Steam has been restarted - it will appear in your list of games.

Read full topic
